name: 資訊系統評鑑研究
description:
The goals of this course is to equip the students with the understanding and hands-on ability to familiarize with the methods of assessing performance and value, with emphasis on evaluating each system or service in its context. Specification of criteria, measures, measuring instruments, and methods of evaluation related to a variety of library services, and to information retrieval (IR) systems.

1.      Introduction to course

2.      Disruptive technologies vs. Balanced Scorecard. For reference only:

3.      Hernon/Whitman: Delivering Satisfaction and Service Quality.

4.      Methodological issues in evaluation/performance studies

5.      Framework for improving ServQual & Customer Satisfaction over time:

6.      Qualitative measures used in evaluation

7.      Creating a new service model

8.      Satisfaction: measurement and evaluation

9.      Quantitative measures used in evaluation. Computer applications.


10.  New assumptions and new designs for planning alternative futures
